sentences: Me peame kütust ostma enne reisi algust.
context: The word 'kütust' is the partitive form of 'kütus', which means 'fuel'. It indicates an unspecified amount or portion of fuel. This Estonian word refers to combustible material used to produce energy, commonly referring to gasoline/petrol for vehicles but can also refer to other types of fuel. The -st ending indicates it's in the partitive case, meaning 'some fuel' or 'fuel (unspecified amount)'.
